title: Turok 2 Seeds of Evil playthrough -- Part 4
description: Finished it up with some help from the chat. Very confusing level design, but overall I enjoyed it a lot. Love the weapons, enemies, and the level aesthetics and it's cool to finally have beaten this game.

fragments.text: Christ, I forgot how much screen realestate is taken up by weapons in this game.
Yeah they were I'm fairly certain, but man, dat melee weapon was like a full quarter of the screen
I miss games having maps like this.
shar's consistency is just astounding tbh
So other than Turok II any other games you're planning on getting into cube?
Oh you got the new rig up? That's awesome.
I thought I cancelled it a couple months ago but apparently it didn't actually

yeah, why do you stream at all??

but all of those were manufactured before I even bought the thing
so do I really feel like I'm having an effect on any of it?
I prefer old FMV games personally >.>
or am I just watching a role that occasionally lets me take the helm in some probably-boring way
usually I rationalize that I will forgive the game's story is the game itself is fun
developers from nightdive said that the difficulty settings not worked on bosses
I mean people like mass effect because of the story
or is the game also good and the story enhances it
a lot of people think the gameplay wasn't that good
right but the story was great so people kept playing it

that most gamers are more interested in playing a role than playing a game

but I do enjoy those old style FMV games like tex murphy, harvester, etc cause the way they tell the story is fun
